author: Simon Williams
title: chevron-right
text: MYRTLE BEACH, S.C. (WPDE) — The Myrtle Beach Police Department (MBPD) recognized 21 years without their fellow Officer Joe McGarry Friday with a wreath-laying ceremony. He was shot and killed while trying to speak with a murder suspect on North Kings Highway on December 29, 2002. NEW: [Classic 1969 Camaro stolen from Robeson County home](https://wpde.com/news/local/classic-1969-camaro-stolen-robeson-county-red-springs-home-free-standing-carport-december-28-2023) Assistant Police Chief Marty Brown said he’ll never forget that phone call and because of it, asked everyone to do something they’ve been putting off. “Just take time to do it. Call your parents and have dinner with them. Call up an old friend and shoot the breeze for a little while, somebody you haven’t talked to in a while, just give them a call. I promise you they will remember it,” he said at the ceremony. Top 10 stories of 2023: [Bubbling ocean, senior prank, international incidents & Doyle disappearance](https://wpde.com/news/local/ocean-bubbles-pee-dee-high-school-senior-prank-tyler-doyle-viral-video-tik-tok-f-35b-fighter-jet-crash-atf-gun-laws-mexico-kidnapping-murder-plastic-surgery-chinese-spy-balloon-shot-down-myrtle-beach-whataburger-socastee-swing-bridge-crash-dash-cam) Assistant Chief Brown said he named his son after Officer McGarry and helped design the memorial fountain outside the police department. He invited anyone to view the memorial when visiting the area.
